entry.title: Conclusion
entry.content:

entry.title: Ideas
entry.content: ## 3. Ideas ! In this part I've outlined some of ideas I've had previously and helped implement. I will have more ideas after learning more about the bioinformatics team with you. -- Ideas - Build custom RShiny apps and help train biologists with clear documentation of how they work. - Furthermore, we could imbed these in Django directly and build a suite of Rshiny bioinformatics tools and visualizations https://github.com/mfcovington/djangocms-shiny-app - Creating high quality automation pipelines using Python together with R in some cases - Biologists often have experience with R. - Thus deploy an R package (customized and unit tested by us including statistical analyses), that biologists can install directly and perform an analysis they often require. - Can deploy Rstudio on AWS or Nuritas servers (Quick demo as required) - Collect all data - Possibly contribute with building a database in MongoDB (or other) of unstructured sources in the "Target" phase. - Collect data from the lab (ie. google sheets API or other example), store this data in a database to make more information available for the biological scientists. - Delivery of automated emails of Excel workbooks that deliver updated information of interest to the team. -- Previous experience implementing ideas. - Xanadu Consultancy. - Knime workflows to bring value straight away by interacting with marketing and adopting an agile approach. - NFTN app, to help customers make informated betting decisions. - Identifying client IP address user agenets and from raw log files to identify fraudlent activity. - Pacific Radiology. - Collecting manual entered data from all areas of the busines and interacting with teams to ensure the data follows certain rules and privalges. - The value is that once we have more data we can find more insights. - Another solution involved automating extracts to Tableau which significantly increased performance of reports.

entry.title: Position_profile
entry.content: ## 2. Position Profile ! -- Responsibilities of the role and experience. - Developing Bioinformatics software. - Python and R package development and creating functions. - Large volumes of biological data - Experience: Cassandra, Spark, AWS, Google bigquery. - Bioinformatics : Large scale biological data. - Data extraction and integration: - Experience : Reporting and automation. - SQL and NoSQL experience. - Ensuring high quality data. - Experience : Test driven development in previous project. This involved adding testing suites to a python packge we were developing for all data queries. - Help with training colleagues across the business. - Pacific radiology as an example -- Technical skills with examples. - Python and R developer. - Building fucntions and contributing to the analytics packages (R and python) - Very comfortable with SQL and NoSQL databases and interacting with APIS and JSON formats. - Experience with web development. - Used Flask before but have not created Django apps previously (something I would love to get experience doing) - RShiny visualizations and javascript libraries. - Learning javascript and experimenting (such as with this presentation) with more javascript. - Comfortable with Linux and windows. - Bioinformatics tools. - FYP in Genetics using tools like Blast alignment and a custom tool to analyze GC content in genomes to predict anomolies. -- ##### 2. Position Profile overview. Biological sciences background with a good domain understanding. Commercial experience in creating high quality/performant analytics programs. Good soft skills developed in working abroad with people of differing backgrounds. Focused on good teamwork and ability to learn and deliver projects independently.

entry.title: Career_history
entry.content: ### 1. Career history: College ! Biology | Data Science :-------------------------:|:-------------------------: | BSc Genetics (UCC) 2010, MSc Immunology and Global Health (NUIM) 2012 | HDip Data Science and Analytics (CIT) (2014) -- - **_BSc Genetics 2010_** - Genomics, Bioinformatics, Statistics, Molecular biology, Microbiology, Immunology and many other modules relating to Genetics. - Final year project in bioinformatics (investigating bacterial pseudogenes in failed horizontal gene transfer events) -- - **_MSc Immunology and Global Health 2012_** - Epidemiology and disease modelling, molecular immunology, proteomics/bioinformatics, anthropology and the spread of disease. - Master thesis. Preperation of a genomic library of a virulent e-coli strain known to be associated with Crohn's disease in humans. -- - **_HDip Data Science and Analytics 2014_** - Mathematics, statistics, distributed computing, Python and R programming, machine learning. - Thesis. Sentiment analysis and opinion mining of Twitter using a Naive Bayes classifier. -- Twitter Sentiment Analysis on real time data. The above graph represents a time series of sentiment over time for the world cup final in 2014.I gave presentations on this algorithm and the thesis in CIT and the CSO in Cork. --- ### 1. Career history. Work ! ##### Experience working in data science - I joined Xanadu consultancy in 2014 as a Junior Data Scientist initially. - First worked in the "Data Analytics" team (2 years). - Then promoted and worked in the "Data Products" team (~9 months). -- ##### Data Analytics Team at Xanadu (~2 years) - Haproxy log files - Setup processes in MongoDB, later Google Bigquery. Using granular data (Sessions) for determining how users were interactin on the website. The aim was to help marketing understand uptake of promotions (example use of the Apple watch app among many other questions). - R package for data analytics team. - Personalization (e.g. twitter, personal news feed ) - Migration of BI reports from MySQL to Cassandra and developing Spark processes. - Many other data projects, including fraud detection alerts (Linking users report), LTV, Churn, Twitter prototypes - Prices analytics (NFTN tool) (Example below) -- NFTN tool (News from the Numbers application) https://wheeldogg.github.io/programming/2018/07/23/data-visualization-of-betting-markets/ -- ##### Data Products Team at Xanadu (~9 months) - Bonus platform engine. - Scrum team (two data scientists, Java engineer and product owner) - Gamification and personalization based on criteria and customer interactions - I specifically worked on "DBStreams". This involved converting MySQL and Cassandra queries in fucntions that could be called in Python to retreive a "stream" of historical events stored in the database - Automation of Knime Workflows created by marketing data insights analyst. Converting manual knime analytics workflows to automated solutions (example is in image above). This meant that my process would send information of customers and the amount of cash to receive in their accounts directly to the endpoint on the betting API. - Python analytics package for easier access to repeatable queries that were unit tested. -- Worked in New Zealand as a BA/Data Scientist. - Helped implement and build the data analytics infrastructure in the company - Automated data extraction and reports and delivery via Tableau, Rshiny and Excel workbooks. - Collected via Google sheets API from all areas of the business - Built a HR database of all employees (clinicians and administration). - Importance in terms of FTE and productivity analyis. - Remuneration. - Cost pricing model - Operations pack. - A lot of work for this was costing the company as was being outsourced, then we started using R to run TSQL procedures and build our own dashboards in Tableau. - Voice of the patient. Text messages to customers. - Helped train BI analyst's how to use some of the data analytics Jupyter notebooks and R. - Prototyped a radiologist productivity app in Rshiny. - Documentation ! -- ##### 1. Career history and skills relevant to Nuritas Background in biological sciences (mostly college) and data science (commerical environements). I've worked on a number of varying data sets and I'm hopeful that the next domain will be again Biology which was my passion in getting into sciecen initially. In the next section when reviewing the position description I'll describe in more detail the tools used.

entry.title: Welcome
entry.content: ## Shane Whelan Interview for Nuritas Bioinformatician. --- ## Topics. #### Three main sections to discuss - **1. Career history:** - Previous work experience and projects relevant to Nuritas. - **2. Position profile:** - How I believe my experience and background will be a good fit for the team. - Data analytics tools and key competencies. - **3. Ideas:** - Concepts and ideas that may be of interest and previous experience implementing ideas
entry.summary: ## Shane Whelan Interview for Nuritas Bioinformatician.
